reviewText: Like all of Kazuo Hara's movies, this one is a life changing experience. His documentaries have almost ruined all other film for me. The things you will witness in this movie are unbelievable. Only the early films of Werner Herzog, Errol Morris (both huge admirers of Kazuo Hara) and also Joshua Oppenheimer's The Act of Killing come close.

Do you have too much time? Waste it here. It will be thoroughly, nihilistically, vacuously squandered. (Never seen anything so bad,
and I've seen some stinkers.) Phew.
